newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: CRICKET-RANATUNGA LEADS SRI LANKA INTO FINAL.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-RANATUNGA LEADS SRI LANKA INTO FINAL.

text.p: Captain Arjuna Ranatunga led Sri Lanka to a fine victory over India on Friday and a place in the Asia Cup final.
Ranatunga hit 131 not out as Sri Lanka reached the 228 target with 32 ball and six wickets to spare.
The world champions made a poor start in reply to India's 227 for six. Sanath Jayasuriya fell for a duck off the first ball and was quickly followed by Aravinda De Silva for six runs.
But then man-of-the match Ranatunga played his team out of trouble at nine for two, amassing his runs off 152 balls. He hit 17 fours.
Hitting everything the Indians sent at him, Sri Lanka's skipper shared an unbroken fifth wicket stand of 106 with rookie wicket-keeper Lanka De Silva.
Their partnership broke the Asia Cup record of 72 set by Aminul Islam and Akram Khan of Bangladesh against Pakistan at Sharjah in 1995.
Ranatunga surpassed his own one-day international mark of 102 and scored the most number of runs by any player in an Asia Cup match.
The previous highest individual Asia Cup score was 124 not out by Pakistan's Ijaz Ahmed against Bangladesh at Chittagong in 1988.
It was a bad day for Ranatunga's counterpart, Sachin Tendulkar, who fell for 21. India had to rely on Tendulkar's predecessor, Mohammad Azharuddin, who scored 81 off 103 balls.
